Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a small off-white head. Has a slightly roasted malty caramel chocolate hoppy aroma. Slightly roasted malty citrus hoppy bitter caramel flavor. Has a slightly roasted malty citrus hoppy bitter caramel finish.

33ml Bottle from malting pot. 
Sampled at home. 
Its a good black IPA from Austria.

It pours out an almost pitch black body with a brownish tint and a beige frothy head. The aroma is very hoppy for a black IPA  a good amount of citrusy hops; grapefruit, orange zest and tangerine notes most notably. There is the slightest bit of a toasted note underneath the hops, but damn, this smells great! The taste is a mixture of burnt malts and citrusy hops. The flavors are layered so tight that it keeps changing between toasty and hoppy  its really interesting! Its very juicy, and theres a fair bit of pine coming through towards the end. Its always hard to judge these beers, because youd expect a big roasted and full bodied beer just by looking at the color, but when you drink it its like drinking a proper IPA. Easy going down, nice levels of carbonation, and a nice bitter finish. Bevog has really made a nice beer with this one. You really get all the good stuff from both the hops and the malts  but its still on the IPA side of things (and not a hoppy stout). This is solid!
Bottle at de Kleine Deugniet, Alkmaar: Black colored brew with an dry bitter taste, hints of citrus, roasted malts and some dried fruits and chocolate.

Toasted grain and cereal malts, floral hops, dark fruits, citrus, ripe orange. Hazy, dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Light bitter. More dark fruits, floral hops, charcoal, sweet grain backbone, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Very nice CDA, well-balanced and rich. Keg at Hop Locker, Waterloo.

Keg at Mels Craft beer and cafe. Pours black with a thin white head. Aroma is coffee, cocoa and dried fruits. Taste is a nice roasted malt, coffee and cocoa hit that gives way to a bitter hoppy finish, a bit of pine and some dryness. Carbonation good. A solid CDA

Keg at The Hop Locker, Southbank, London. A dark brown coloured pour with a medium creamy beige white head on top. Roasty, malty, hoppy, pine aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, hoppy, citrus, pine with a bitter finale. Very nice indeed.

Pours dark brown from the bottle and leaves a frothy, head that lingers and turns creamy. Lots of evident lacing. Aroma is tropical fruit with chocolate truffle undertones. Taste is up front bittersweet with chocolate, hazelnut and fruity notes, trending distinctly more bitter going into the finish. Amazingly well balanced. Body is medium to full and a bit oily over a mild carbonation. A true pleasure to drink.

On tap (flight 2#4) at Brickmasters, Vienna on 14-May-2017. Almost black in colour with a medium sized beige coloured head. Aroma of dark fruits, roasted malt and pine. Full body and medium carbonation. Taste is earthy - roasted malt, coffee, chocolate. Medium bitterness and hoppy. A pretty nice Cascadian IPA.

robe très sombre au col fin. gout forestier et bien grillé quon croit boire un feu de racines. amertume parfaitement controlée.

The taste is soft, creamy, roasted with notes of dark chocolate, caramel-licorice, grapefruit and a bit dark fruits. The bitterness is earthy, zesty and even resinous braiding of roasting.

Aroma of toasted malt,green grass.taste of dark sugar,malt, fain coffee, milk chocolate and roasted grain perfectly balanced with pineapple, resin and other bitter tastes. Medium body with nice carbonation and a bitter-sweet aftertaste. All in all, a pleasant beer,but need more hop.
Dark cola colour with a thin, off-white head. Aroma is toasted malt, pumpkin flesh, and wet grass. Taste is coffee, liquorice, and bitter chocolate.
couleur noire; mousse beige; arômes et goût maltés, fruités et de chocolat; finale bien amère

Bottle. Very dark brown polished chestnut, golden brown head. Fresh grassy, sweaty and citric hop aroma on a caramel/bisquit and roast malt base. Medium light body, dry chocolate/coffee roast and licorice notes, lightly burned. Coffee retronasal. Tends towards a Imperial baltic porter.

Data ważności:  29.11.2017 
 Kolor:  Barwą przypomina nieco coca-colę. Czysty, klarowny trunek. Pod światło widać niezliczone rubinowe refleksy. 
 Piana:  Ciemnokremowa, drobnoziarnista, puszysta i obfita.
Piana wydaje się nie mieć końca.
Otacza ścianki kielicha ogromnymi łańcuszkami.
Nad piwiem wisi gruba, conajmniej 3 cm otoczka.
Rewelacja! 
 Zapach:  Simcoe Till I Die! Aromat wybitnie żywiczny, mocny zdecydowany zapach sosnowych gałązek.
Na przeciwległym biegunie nuty czekolady deserowej, odrobina cytrusów i korzennych chmieli.
Na szarym końcu leciutki przypalony karmel. 
 Smak:  W smaku przede wszystkim żywica, las, igły sosnowe i modrzewiowe.
Dalej pojedyncze cytrusy i nuty korzenne.
Sporo także ciemnych słodów i prażonego zboża, a co za tym idzie sugestie prażonego słonecznika.
Przypalony karmel obecny również w sporej ilości.
Goryczka jest masywna, trochę za długa.
Finisz długi, lekko ściągający, wybitnie żywiczny, a także palony od słodów.
Umiarkowana ciało, oleista tekstura.
Mocno nachmielone IPA, bardzo goryczkowe, tylko dla twardzieli ;) 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie do średniego. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Typ takiego hardcorowego Black IPA. Solidna dawka chmielu skutkowała powstaniem piwa bardzo goryczkowego, intensywnie żywicznego z ogromną dozą palonych słodów.
Bardzo stonowane akcenty czekolady deserowej, przypalonego karmelu, czy korzennych chmieli nie są w stanie zrównoważyć mocnego żywiczno-palonego pazura.
Piwo może zrobić wrażenie, ale na fanach mocno nachmielonych, agresywnych piw w stylu Black IPA. Ja wole zdecydowanie lżejsze wersje.

67 IBU. Donkerbruin tot zwart bier met beige schuimkraag. Geur: rood fruit, likeur, schotelwater, groene hop. Smaak: hopbitter, chocolade en iets zoet. Rond van smaak, redelijk volmondig. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: lang, bitter, wat zoet plakkerig.
Bottle courtesy of Iznogud, thanks! Jet black color, tan head with solid lacing. Aroma of coffee and pine. Taste is chocolate and bitter coffee. Tasty.

Mõnus puuviljane aroom. Maitse kirjeldamiseks sobiks kõige paremini greibikoor ja kuuseokkad. Tahaks rohkem hapukust tunda. Alul tundus, et käib kah, aga mida lonksuke edasi, seda meeldivamaks muutus. Aga jäägu pigem ainsaks proovimiseks kui just väga hea hinnaga pakuta.

from tap (nitrogen), clear very dark with a hint of red, light brown creamy head. 
intense peach/stone fruit aroma, hint of malt, caramel and coffee
wel balanced with a medium bitterness in finish.
medium to full body, oily texture

W nosie słabo/średnio dominuje ciemne aromaty kawa, deserowa czekolada, w tle trochę słodkich tropików i żywicy, generalnie w aromacie jest słodko. Kolor ciemno brązowy z rubinowymi refleksami, piana niska, dość szybko się redukuje do firanki. W smaku już nie tak słodko dominują nuty palone, kawa, przypieczona skórka od chleba, gorzka czekolada, minimalna nuta żywiczna, generalnie w smaku brakuje nut chmielowych jak na BIPA. Goryczka średnia, palona. Butelka do 31.08.2017

Sample at Borefts 2016. Poured a clear dark brown with a frothy light tan head. The aroma is yeast, floral, light hop. The flavour is moderate liqourice bitter with a smoky ashtray roasty light hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle. Sensoric. Dark brown, clear with moderate, dirty white, frothy head. Good head retention, moderate lacing. Moderate malty aroma - mainly roasted malts, cocoa, licorice, sweet malts. Moderate hoppy aroma - mainly citrus (grapefruit) and piney notes. Taste is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter, long duration, stable. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, fisnih is grapefruit, bitter, long, semi-dry. Summary: Very good brew. The roasted malts do not dominate the beer, as it is often in Black IPAs. Bitterness is nice, aroma is mainly concentrated on citrus and piney notes. Podsumowanie: Black IPA takie jak powinno być. Przede wszystkim paloność jest słabo wyczuwalna, dominują nuty cytrusowo-grejfrutowe, żywiczne, sosnowe. Goryczka bardzo przyjemna, długo utrzymująca się. Jakbym zamknął oczy to stwierdziłbym, że to dobre AIPA.

Forest berries are present, some dried plums too. Body is light sweet that goes into long dry resinous bitterness. Not overwhelming though. Body is medium with slick mouth feel and average carbonation. Nicely rounded black IPA.

Draft at Borefts 2016, Day 2. Near clear brown with a cream head. Aroma of fruity hops, malt, caramel and toffee. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. [24-09-2016]

Medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!

Great stuff. Its why I love Black IPAs, there?s much to explore and never feel heavy if done well like this. (On tap at Borefts 2016)

Tap at Borefts. Clear very dark brown with big beige head. Dark chocolate, grassy hops, citrus peel, lime, chalk, old coffee. Medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with slick feel.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, bread, dark fruit, liquorice, roasted malts and hops.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/dark brown beer with a slight beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit and liquorice; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread, roasted malts and hops.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Might be too balanced, but the taste does not suffer. The palate is rather thin however. A great mix of roasted malts and hops, creating a great Black IPA.

330 ml bottle. Reddish black colour, small but remaining head, good lacing, soft carbonation. Sweet herbs and toffee in the nose, well-rounded moutfeel, again sweetness, coffee, long lasting bitterness in the aftertaste. Nicely balanced and complex BIPA. Good stuff!

at Mels Craft Beer and Dinner - Vienna . Pours black, small grey head. Smell is weak, bit bitter. Taste is bitter, aromatic, dark malts. Chocolaty. A BIPA that makes scence ( only a very few do ) . very creamy MF .

At a tasting, thanks, smallish head, deep brown color, aroma of chocolate, herbs and some dark bread, flavor of chocolate with some nuttiness, a little too sweet, medium bitterness, a bit unbalanced, Nice just a bit too old.

Full bodied and still smooth despite its bitterness. An excellent black IPA, really liked it!

Black with a light head. Great aroma of roasted malts and pine. Toasty flavor with a hint of coffee and chocolate with a big hoppy bite. Damn good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, Miners Pub, Belgrade. Dark, clearish brown. Tall rich foam. Cool roast. Very smooth body. Great black IPA example with good rest hops. nice roast backbone. Delicious.

21-05-2016, Delft Doerak met Lou

Verassend! Black IPA, zwarte kleur met lichtere schuimkraag. Enorm bitter, je ruimt een frisse aroma maar je proeft een donkere smaak naar koffie, donker fruit. Ik zeg prima lou zegt super, favo.

On tap @ Vienna Bierfest: Dark brown color. A very strong cappucino, roasty and biscuity malt aroma with a hint of tropical fruity hops. A very coating and lasting mouthfeel. The roasted malt really dominates but Im not complaining at all.

Pours dark brown with an average off-white head. Aroma of strongly roasted malt and heavily hoppy (flowers, lime). Smooth and balanced initial flavor - lightly sweet and bitter and a little fruity with a heavy bitter ending and an alcoholic aftertaste. Very nice beer.

Bottle @Bir&Fud Bottega (Rome). Pours deep brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, nuts, hops (citrus), well balanced. Flavour is well balanced too, roasted notes with a light hops bitterness. Medium body, medium to light carbonation. Nice!

Pitch black, low beige head. Aroma roastiness, cocoa, grapefruit and tart cherries. Palate medium, low carbonation. Taste citrusy, coffee, medium-dry finish with lasting biterness and toffee ending. Not so special in complexity albeit precisely balanced. A very good IBA.
Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt vol, vanille, koffie, hop, drop. Smaakt bitter, drop, koffie. Tikkeltje dun. Bittere afdronk.

Wow! I love this! Subtle and quite complex. Well balanced, not too sweet, not too bitter. Roasted malts, a bit of coffee and chocolate, red and citrus fruits, resin, sweet dried fruits. Nice mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33 bottle, Beerlovers Vienna. Intensive fruit/citrus aroma. Dark brown/black color with white head. Overwhelming citrus, floral and roasted coffee taste. Your palate wants to jump out of the mouth. Beer of the day!
Starts with a great hard heavy taste which than ends with a bit too souer ending. Great barley aroma. The apearance in ok but no to bold or original.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Almost opaque black with a beige head. Big hoppy nose - tropical fruit, some resins, coffee with milk and caramel topping. Taste: starts quite sweet, but the citrusy bitterness does not give it a chance. A piece of sweet chocolate somewhere in the background. Medium body, smooth mouth feel. Very nice.

Bottle from Yeme Btaislava. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma of chocolate and citrusy. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Strong bitterness supported by rich malty backbone. Long lasting bitterness in aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Color mogano scuro molto limpido con bei riflessi rubino. Cappello di schiuma color cappuccino, cremosa,abbondante e persistente. Al naso pompelmo rosa e aghi di pino su dolci note tostate. Corpo nella media con carbonazione come da stile. Al palato ancora agrumi e qualche nota tropicale (mango e passion fruit). Lievissima nota tostata e amaro molto deciso che vira sullerbaceo. Buona la pulizia e ottimo lequilibrio, manca forse di un po di secchezza. Ottima comunque.
Alla spina. Classica Black IPA con note dolci e fruttate e altre tostate più amarognole. Corpo medio lieve ma non acquosa o scipita, piacevolissima anche durante il pasto.
Bottle, 330 ml from Pivoteka, Zagreb. Shared with JFK10000. Pours dark brown with large lasting beige head. Hoppy, roasted malts, coffee, bitter finish. Very drinkable. Quite good.
Roasted malts, a touch of caramel, then a spicy finish. I do not like the black IPA s but this one is nice.

bottle from @Saeglopur [European Local swap 1/2016], thanks
pours black with a full brown head, aroma of pine, laurel, mpderate hops, dark malt aroma. Taste of long high hop flavor, long laurel and pine, some chocolate, soft, liquorice, roasted notes, smooth mouthfeel, medium body, light smooth alcohol warming notes,

Palackból. Nagy, tömör, örökké tartó bézs hab, fekete szín. Illata intenzív, citrusos, komlós, tipikus ipás, plusz némi pörkölt malátás aroma. Erős american ipás ízvilág, citrusos, gyantás, markáns keserűvel. Hosszú, kesernyés, gyümölcsös utóíz. Testes, de nem nehéz, jó egyensúly, de kissé túlságosan is intenzív.

Tasted from the tap on the 04/03/2016 at the Barcelona Beer Festival. Black colour with a medium and creamy beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, medium hoppy and some grapefruit. Taste is roasted and medium sweet. Intense hoppy finish. Next one please!

330ml bottle enjoyed @ home, thanks to Werckmeister! Pours pitch black with a creamy and long lasting off-white head. Aroma is roasted malt, milk chocolate, pine, bready, grapefruit, coffee-ish and herbal. Flavour is medium bitter and subtle sweetness. Medium bodied, smooth texture, soft carbonation. Finish is well-balanced, light roasted and slightly resinous.
Bottle 0.33l at Beerville Bar Belgrade Serbia.22.12.2015.Pour it dark black color wtih no head.Aroma biscuits and resin.Taste salty,grassy,roasted malts,sticky sweet, soft carbonation.Ok interesting.
Bottle from werckmeister, thanks! Blackish pour with a generous off white head. Notes of pine, light roast, fresh fruity coffee, grapefruit and some caramel.

Rated pe 12.02.2016.bottle. Black, offwhite cream head. Roasty soft, slight milkey, but piney, some citrus on nose. Med bodied, pretty smooth, good bitters, filling, hoppy piney fla our. Clean, flavourful. Piney soft roasty ale. Real nice.-- bb
From bottle. Shows a dark color as promised and a brown head. Hoppy nose and good bitter taste. Still sweet, roasty and notes of chocolate. Interesting and good beer!

Bottiglia 33 cl. Scurissima e intensa con schiuma beige. Al naso malto torrefatto e sentori erbacei. Corpo medio, sapore avvolgente di malto, cioccolato, caffè. Lalcol non è mai invadente. Non avevo mai bevuto una black ipa e questa mi ha davvero impressionato. Ottima.
Bottiglia da 33 cl. Birra scura con schiuma persisente e di color nocciola. Allolfatto ottimo odore speziato con un gusto erboso e cioccolatoso. Molto buona.

Bottle. Unexpectedly malty beer, with bread and raisins leading the way. Light chocolatey, quite roasted, especially in the finish, where the bitterness is more roast- than hop-derived. Ciotrusy and resiny hop notes are evident yet not dominating. Some earthy undertones. Quite original take on the style, I liked it very much.

Drinking from a 33 cl bottle. 
A hoppy aroma. 
The clear brown beer has a medium off-white head. 
This is a very nice trasting beer.
Medium carbonated.

0.33 bottle from Beerightback.
almost black, with ruby reflections and big brown head.
sweet hop aroma, herbal and piney.
taste is a nice mix of aromatic hops and bitter black malt, with smokey final. alcohol il well hidden.

Bottle at World Wine Gallery Myjava, color is black with light tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, fruit, mostly pineapple, dark chocolate. Taste - coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate, roasted malt. Light sweet with decent bitter finish.

Pullo @ Uba & Humal, Tallinna. Kaatuu snifteriin sysimustana, kolmen sormen paksuisen ja kiinteän vaahdon suojaamana. Tuoksusta iskee tasaisesti sekä hieman kahvin suuntaan taipuva paahde sekä makean hedelmäinen ja havuinen humalointi. Hieman suklaatakin löytyy. Maussa tuntuu heti alkuun lakritsinen juurisuus ja paahteisuus, kahviakin on. Näitä seuraa jo selvästi taustalla oleva humalointi, joka käsitää puuta ja havua. Suutuntuma on melko paksu, humalointi on jo taittunut (BBE maaliskuussa 2016), mutta tuntuu hieman jälkimaussa. Tasapainoinen BIPA, jossa stoutin elementit ovat jo hallitsevassa osassa ja humalan aromikkuus on melkeimpä enää tuoksussa.

Bottle at Beerville pub in Belgrade-Serbia. Pours black, almost no head. Nose: very orangey, sweet lemonade, where is all this black? Nice. Mouth: so clean, watery, a bit dry. The citric character is well balanced by the important citric end. Liked it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle at home. Very dark brown with a small tan head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Quite bitter with subtle sweet tones. Coffee, dark chocolate, hops, brown sugar, vanilla and spices. Tasty!

Bottle share on the 42nd floor. Thanks to Fergus for the Austrian BIPA tick. As Bevog Rudeen. Black, red hue, small foamy brown head. Aroma is rose, sweet malts, molasses, sugars, floral astringency. Body is medium, smooth, soft carbonation. Taste is flowery, resinous, citrus, very sweet coffee, red pepper, earthy finish. Pretty tasty, rounded BIPA. Good.

Bottle 330ml. @ home. [ As Bevog Rudeen Black IPA ].[ Courtesy of my Local Swap 2015-2 - Saeglopur ]. Clear dark black brown color with a large, frothy - creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, dark malt, roasted, sweet malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, hoppy. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, roasted, dark malt, hoppy, citrus, woody. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20151119]
Coffee, kirsch wasser and hoppy tar aromas. Long and smooth bitterness with nice tobacco, caramell and kirsch flavours. Super!

Bottle at home. Aroma is roasted malt, grapefruit, coffee, hops, pine, citrus, tropical fruits. Flavour is light sweet with a bitter finish. Body is medium. Wow, this beer actually manages to match the awesome bottle art. Hugely fruity and roasty tropical coffee BIPA, if this had a little more depth it would be close to perfection for the style.

Pitch black pour, with a light-tan head with nice retention. It almost looks like a fresh oatmeal stout. The smell is something else, though - tropical fruit hops (pineapple, mostly), salt, mixed with freshly brewed coffee, cocoa, roasted and chocolate. The taste is, again, a blend of a milk stout and a super-hopped-up IPA. Coffee, milk chocolate and roasted grain perfectly balanced with pineapple, resin and other bitter tastes. They might sound like contrasting tastes, but they actually blend together rather neatly, making for a surprisingly balanced brew. Medium body with nice carbonation and a bitter-sweet aftertaste. All in all, a pleasant experience.

Bottle at the second 42nd Floor tasting. It pours black with a medium+ light tan head. The nose is fresh, bitter-sweet, earthy, toasted maltage, rich roast and some rocky road. The taste is quite bitter, hard roast, rich, earthy, charred wood, pine, cocoa and alcohol boost. Medium body and moderate carbonation. A bit too harsh and alcoholic on the palate for me. Overall not bad, but I had hoped for a bit more.

330ml bottle, from trade with Werckmeister. Many thanks! Pours very dark with good fluffy tan head. Aroma is good dark malts and sinister hops. Taste is slick, dark malts, some pine, light liquorice, teasing bitterness. Very decent black IPA.
Sample at Örebro Öl & Whisky. Hoppy smell with grape pine and chocolate. Similar taste. Nice BIPA!

Bottle in a hotel room in Vienna.
Dark brown coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Fruity and light roasted aroma of chocolate and licorice with notes of hops.
Roasted flavour of caramel, hops and chocolate.
Roasted finish.

Bottle at home, 27th November 15. Dark and slightly hazy. Aroma is chocolate, some hops, cocoa. Taste is chocolate, slight grain, some bitterness, pine. Light lingering bitterness. Probably needs a little more hops. pretty good

How: Bottle.
Where: SBWF 2015.
Appearance: Dark brown colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Liquorice, roasted malt, bread, spice, grapefruit.
Body: Medium body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Roasted malt, pine, liquorice, hops, caramel.

33 cl bottle. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is grapefruity and peachy. Citrusy. Toasted dark malty and grapefruity. Bitter and roasted dark malty. Bitter and solid hopp finish.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 33cl bottle at home (21 XI 2015), shared with friends. A black IPA with reddish gloom and beautiful beige foam. The nose has gooseberries, some bread, loads of hops and fruits. The flavours are phenomenal. The taste is less sweet than expected from the many fruitful scents. This is lovely coffee bitter, some caramel, blue berries, hugely hopped, and very, very tasteful.

bottle from bierpost. Deep black with a mid-sized, creamy brown head. Chocolatey and fruity hop aromas blend together. More dark chocolate, coffee and berries, also some earthyand fruity hops tune in. Quite complex, yet dangerously drinkable also due to the smooth and velvety mouthfeel.

10th November 2015Tower 42 Tasting 2. Thanks to Fergus. Light haze on this dark brown beer, good pale tan head. Palate is light and semi dry. Modest fine carbonation. Smooth sweetish dark malts. Mild roasty bitterness contrasts. Mild dark chocolate. Light pine and mild floral bitterness. Semi dry finish. Smooth and tasty enough, could be a little hoppier.

Bottle shared at Canary wharf tasting . 10/11/2015. From Beer hawk. Murky brown coloured pour with a lasting loose mid tan head. Aroma is nutty malts, earthy pine, woody. Flavour is composed of fruity berry, resinous pine, caramel and earthy pine. Palate is medium full bodied, moderate carbonation. Lingering berry, Good black ipa. Lovely.

Bottle split on the 42nd floor, thanks to Fergus, 10/11/15.
Dark mahogany brown topped with a decent beige covering. 
Nose is pine, brown bread, nutty tones, light spice, grapefruit, straw.
Taste carries a light cocoa sprinkling, earthy hop presence, pine needle, toasted brown sugar, red berry notes. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with earthy hop bitterness. 
Decent enough CDA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 33cl bottle shared at the Tumbler 42 tasting, London. It pours a hazy light brown color with a small head. Aroma is citric grassy tangy. Tate is dry acidic grassy with pine cones. Medium bodied with ok carbonation. Overall, ok

Bottle shared in London on the 42nd floor - big thanks to Fergus. Pours deep brown with a creamy tan head. The aroma holds roast, cocoa, burnt pine, grapefruit. Medium sweet flavor with oily chocolate, bitter pine, baking cocoa, dark berries. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Lightly resinous on the finish, some burnt toast, pine, cocoa. Not bad overall.

33cl Bottle from Vonk. Black colour, creamy beige head. Aroma of hops, chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, grapefruit, some pine. Flavour is medium sweet, lovely chocolate notes, roasted malts, coffee, nicely hopped, bitter finish, some mocha. Light to medium bodied. Great hoppy stout.

330ml bottle at home thanks to Geiserich (European swap 3/2015). Dark brown almost black color with nice frothy to creamy dark beige head that lasts until the end. Hoppy and roasted malty aroma, pine, citrusy fruity, light coffee and chocolate. Sweet and heavy biter taste like aroma, pine and more roasted malty with intense coffee. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Aroma: caramel, coffee,toasted. Appearance: rocky, tan lasting head. Clear, brown. Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter. Palate: medium body, thin texture, bitter finish.
5.3.16 Chestnut color with frothy tan head. Aroma of caramel and goatweed. Taste: coffee, roasty, medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Medium body, oily feel, light carb, long finish

Bottle - Black colour with medium, persistent tan head. A lot of resinous and citrussy hops on the nose with coffee, chocolate and burnt breadcrust. Taste is coffee, caramel, pine, grapefruit. Medium body, average carbonation, hoppy finish with a bit astringent tone. Very nice brew.

Aroma is soft malty and pleasant medium hops. A hint of chocolates and soft spicey. Taste is quite dry and malty, almost ashy. Earth tones down on the low and grapefruit on the higher end. The soft aura almost makes it a bit creamy. Very pleasant and nice BIPA, even if I would have wanted some more kick to it. If youre not that into rough Black IPAs, I highly recommend this one.

Brown color with beige head. Intense hoppy aroma with dankness but also fruity notes. Taste starts really hoppy, makes me think of Simcoe and Centennial. Gets roasty and bitter in the finish. Really nice black IPA, right up my alley.

Bottled, 0.33 l.
Black one with sediments and a creamy lasting beige head on its top, which remains finger thick.
Nose of coffee and pine.
Refined aroma with caramel, coffee, herbs, resin, smooth mouthfeel.
Long, gently warming, grapefruity-roasty finish.
Great BIPA.

Sample at SBWF 2015. 

Black with a tan head. Aroma and taste of hops, light roasted malt, some licorice and grass. The body was medium and the finish quite bitter.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 Super sedimenty. Looks great jet black but the sediment kinda ruins it. Delicious roasted malt and fresh hops. Bitter but cool and flavorful. Well balanced with chocolate and coffee on the palate as the hop bitterness fades. Definitely a home run from the Bevog dudes.
UPDATED: OCT 3, 2015 0,33l fles gedeeld met lion. Zwart met een crème kraag. Geur is heerlijk fruitig perzik appel smaak Is bitterzoet ook fruitig en in de afdronk met cacao en koffie. Toppertje
33 cl bottle. Dark colour with medium off white creamy head and good lacing.Aroma is tropical fruits.Taste is nutty ,roast and cocoa with some tropical hints.Long bitter finish.Lovely beer.

Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival 2015. Black beer with a nice beige/brownish head. Malty caramel aroma, grapes, hoppy, grassy, floral, some cocoa. Hoppy caramel flavor, hay, soot, roasted, caramel, grapes, some licorice. Good one.
Flaska från SB. Svart med beige skum. Humlig doft med en del rostade toner. Torr och lite mjölkig med fin fruktighet.
Black coloured beer with beige head. The aroma is not too intensive, roasted flavours, a hint of grapefruit. The teste is very good, intensive, bitter. All in one, it was not my best beer.

Bottle at home. Black beer, beige big head, good lacing. Aroma is rosted malts, coffee and fruit. Enjoyable. Taste is roasted malts, fruit with wooden and medicinelike bitterness. Over medium palate. Good beer.
Bottle from Erzbierschof Zurich. Some roast aromas, but not too much. Lots of umami on a crisp carbonization with some lemon on the palate. Smooth and on the dry side. Well done, Bevog!
Black in colour, hoppy and citrusy in aroma. Fresh liquorice, tobacco and burnt in aroma. Balanced in taste and low astringency in the end. Good drinkability.

330 ml bottle. BB 05/03/2016. (Uba ja Humal) Tallinn, Estonia.
Dark reddish brown color with a big foamy tan head. 
Fruity hops, mild bitterness, chocolate, mild roasted malt and some soy saltiness in the aroma. The flavor is strong hops, grassy and resiny bitterness, some roasted malt, ashy bitterness and chocolate. Tasty.

Bottle thanks to my summer secret Santa for ticking off a want lister for me! Pours deep deep mahogany, murky almost, large creamy tan head, slow to dissipate, nice lacing. Aroma is roasted malts with a healthy pine and citrus kick. Flavor is rich, malty, and roasty, nice pine resin flavors with some citrus to back it up. Liight plus sweet, medium bitter, rich. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. Some lingering roasty bitterness.
Bottle. Dark brown colour, beige head. Aroma hops, citrusy, roasty, a bit caramel. Taste roasty, bitter, hops. Bitter aftertaste. Very good.

Bottle from Drinkshop. Aroma assertively hoppy, mixed with dark malts to produce classic CDA aroma. Chocolate. Clear very dark colour, stable beige head. Taste lots of chocolate malt, high hoppy bitterness, grassy. Well balanced and somehow easily drinkable. Very good.
Botle kindly shared by Gurthnar, many thanks.  Very dark brown color with light beige head. Roasted malt, citrus hops in aroma. Taste, dark malt, citrus hops. Long hoppy bitter finish. Very good.

Bottle. Pours in black body with high brown creamy head. Aroma has nice tropical character, peach, pineapple, citrus. Taste has pretty high citrus bitterness, backround mostly fruity, like orange peel. A true black IPA for me, I would not guess the color by aroma or flavor. Long lasting bitterness. Body is medium, little bit watery, medium harsh carbonation.

(Bevog Rudeen Black IPA) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a teku, ABV 7.4%
Black colour on the body, two full fingers of thick, beige head sitting on top, with great retention.
Very aromatic, plenty of hops, citrus, orange peel, light roasted malts on the background.
Taste is nicely bitter from the beginning, with flavours of citrus, orange peel, grapefruit, roasted malts chocolate on the finish, very well balanced.
Medium thick body with carbonation on the right levels, very dry on the palate.
One of the best Bevog beers Ive had.

Trade from Werckmeister, many thanks! Pours clear dark ruby with a beige head. Hoppy, citrusy and fairly fruity with moderate malty notes smooth, velvety chocolate and liquorice hides in background. Medium sweet with nice hoppy flavours and a decent bitterness. Very smooth and balanced.

33 cl bottle. BBE 23.04.2016.
Pours dark red-brown color with a large off-white head. Roasted malts and resinous hops on the nose, some orange and faint burnt notes. Dry malty flavor, ashy, some orange notes, grapefruits and gooseberries. Bitter palate. Maybe a bit too ashy for my taste, could be fruitier too, tasty anyway.
3524

Bottle [thanks to Secret Santa Europe 2015] @ weekly tasting shared with Joes and Judyvv. Nice dark brown to black color, full sized a bit soapy off-white to beige head that lasts for quite a long time. Aroma is malts, hops, decently roasty. Taste malts, roasted malts, nicely bitter, nicely hoppy. Medium body and carbonation. Good one!
33cl @ bottle. Aspetto ottimo, aroma maltato, schiuma compatta. Davvero ottima birra scura da questo piccolo birrificio austriaco.

Nice dark brown color with big beige head. Aroma is roasted malts with some citrusy and piney hops. Hints of cat piss. Taste is roasted malts, bitter chocolate, espresso, with citrus and pine, also liquorice. The pine character becomes stronger. Stays very dry. Quite a light juicy mouthfeel but ok. This stuff is awesome. I have to admit now: The reason I used to not like Black IPAs must be that I did not have the best examples of them at first.

Bottle; pours black with a beige head; aroma is citrus with some chocolate, malt, and pine; taste is bittersweet chocolate with citrus, pine, and malt; dry bitter finish some pine and citrus notes; really good BIPA

Bottle from Bier-Deluxe. Black with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt, coffee and moderate hoppy - pine and citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 270715
Bottle. Black color, big light brown head. Lots of coffee, fruits, rye bread notes. Roasty body, coffee, nicely hopped, fruits.

330ml bottle from Bier-Deluxe
Bottled 19.04.15 - Pours black with a foamy light brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, pine, hay, grass, citrus, hints of fruity hops and licorice. Taste is roasty, hoppy and grassy with some licorice, citrus, pine, resin and chocolate. Finish is hoppy, roasty and bitter with some grass, pine and licorice. Pretty tasty and balanced.

Bottle, 7.4%. Black with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, hop and grapefruit. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, hop, grapefruit, pine, medium sweet and medium bitter.

Blackish black colored, strong tan creamy head with nice lacing, a bit of sediment. Aroma is quite hoppy, citrus and floral, chocolate and roasted malt. Taste is low to medium sweet caramel, chocolate, some coffee roastiness and strong hops aroma of pungent citrus and floral hops, medium to high bitterness. Roasted-hoppy dry bitter finish and aftertaste. Medium to full bodied and moderate carbonation, resiny. Super stuff!

Pitch black body, khaki head. Aroma has huge chocolate, medicinal hops, dark side of the fruits. Flavour has chocolate, nice balanced bitterness, huge hop flavopur. Bit pungent, bit medicinal, dark fruits again. Good oily palate. Damn good BIPA.

Bottled 330ml. -from Pivoteka Zagreb. Black coloured, medium to big sized brown head, hops and chocolate in the nose. Roasted malt, dark chocolate, citrusy hoppy and touch of alcohol with dry bitterish finish. Pretty simple but still really nice brew.

Bottle, pours black with a beige head. Aroma: pine, citrus, chocolate. Taste follows with dried pineapple, grass, brambles. Medium sweet, moderate high bitter, creamy texture, average carbonation. Fruity, light liquorice, dry bitter finish. Great india black ale that focusses on the ipa side.

Very dark brown color, big brownish head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, flowers, malts, grass, citrus. Very intense. Taste of chocolate and coffee, more sweet than bitter, citrus, oranges, peaches, herbs. Medium body, soft carbonation. Another great stuff from Bevog.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottled. Pours deep rown nearly black with an average tan head. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, chocolate, citrus and pine. Sweet flavor that ends up dr and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft to average carbonation. A very nice BIPA. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Bottle. Black, head light, very light, drops slowly. Thick lacing. Nose: musky, cat peey hops, very roasty. Taste: extremely nice - more bitter than roasty or chocolaty, with an almost stinging bitter finish. Creamy, soft, velvety mouthfeel, thin carbonation. Damn, this is good. Was among the last beers of a long beer+comedy session, and definitely one of the best.

June 24, 2015. Bottle at home, best before april 23, 2016. Courtesy of Douberd as part of Free Beer Week, thanks Christos! 
Murky brown medium sized tan head. Aroma is licorice, light roast, grass, herbal and some pine. Taste is sweet with licorice, slight toffee, quite creamy with a medium, smooth, grassy bitterness. Finish is smooth grassy bitter with some sweet licorice notes. Medium bodied, creamy texture, average, small bubble carbonation.

Dark brown beer, beige head. Nose is pretty nice, some roasty malt with citric hops, spice, even some chocolate notes. Flavor is hoppy with strong coffee-chocolate overtones, more roast. Hoppy finish. Fairly smooth mouthfeel. Lovely.

33 cl bottle from Tallinn. Pours dark brown with small white head. Nose is somewhat strange, ranging from earthy leaves and ripe plum. Palate is fresh and lively with aromas of pine and pineapples. Stylish brew.

330 ml bottle. Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. Aroma of strong juicy citrus, herbs anf licorice. Flavour of heavy citrusy bitterness, strong licorice, orange sweetness, bitter chocolate and biscuit. Full bodied. Long lingering bitter finish. Really nicely hopped. Great.

Dark brown color, BIG brown long lasting head. Aroma of caramel, roasted malt with some citrus notes. Medium bitter taste with light sweet and light bitter finish. Full and dry body. After this awesomely strange citrus and caramel aroma mix, when you taste sweet caramel on you tongue you know this is THE BEER. Bow down to Bevog.

33cl bottle. Pours dark cola brown with a beautiful bubbly beige head. Aroma is very fresh with roasted malts, bread, light yeast, sweet and tropical fruits. Taste is sweet malts at the beginning followed by a robust roastiness, citrus, tropical fruits. Good final bitterness with resinous and vegetal notes, dry finish medium body, medium carbonation. Very good.

Another marvellous and almost perfect beer from Bevog.
Nothing to say against it.
Drink it and enjoy it!

(on tap at Odprta Kuhna in Lubiana)
Dunkel rötlichbraune Farbe, schöne große beige Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv hopfig, Röstmalz, Kaffee. Geschmack schokoladig, viel Kaffee, im Abgang sehr hopfig, bitter, Kaffeebohnen, gut!

Many thanks to Werckmeister. Thick and dry liquorice dark. Very dry, viscous, nice roasted with Los of dry roasted malts. The hops are in the background under the Espresso-Chocolate layer, but are fresh and floral. Avert interesting. Tastes a bit like the unsweetened cocoa-powder. Great and heavy-deep. Bitter-sweet and very dry finish of floral hop-bitterness and cocoa-powder. Great!

Bottle at Pivoteka. Daaark brown, murky body with a dark tan head, nice! Aroma... light chocolate, light coffee, herbal-lemony notes... More in the taste, slightly sweetish, lime, good bitterness, not aggressive, notes of black chocolate, slightly ashy. Very good!

33cl bottle at home from Only good beer, Budapest. Body is nearly black, head is big, brownish, rocky, mostly lasting, good lacing. Nose is caramel, flavor is chocolate, bonbon, roasted malt, lime, light licorice. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is long lasting hoppy and roasty medium to heavy bitter, light alcohol warmth, later more hoppy. Full body, sticky texture, average carbonation. Easy, tasty dessert beer, great one.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2016 On TAP: Pours dark haze brown, almost black with light brown creamy head. Malt aroma of dark malts, which takes on dark chocolate and coffe, supported with fruity notes, which takes on stone fruits. Flavor: malt flavor are dominant and takes on coffe, chocolate, supported with hop flavors, which takes on stone fruits and pine, with sweet-dry long lasting bitter finish. Malt sweetness is medium, hop bitterness also, body is soft/sticky, carbonation is medium.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2015 Pitch black, big tan head. Lots of herbal hops and roasted malt. Extremely roasty taste, also cocoa, chocolate and moderate bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation. Long slightly bitter finish with coffee notes. Another great Bevog. (Pizzeria OHara 0,33l bottle)

Pours dark with medium head, that does not diminish so quickly. Aroma is not pungent, it is very resilent, but hoppy fresh. Moderate carbonation and pronounces hoppyness wraped in a pleasant fresh body, makes a very pleasant beer.

On bottle with Visionthing, thanks a lot! Very dark brown, almost black Colorado some offwhite foam. High aroma intensity; roasted, hoppy, leather& licorice. Medium/ full body & high complexity. Good bitterness & balance. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle from Drink Shop, Tallinn. Pours clear dark ruby with a beige head. Hoppy, citrusy and fairly fruity with moderate malty notes. Medium sweet with nice hoppy flavours and a decent bitterness. Tasty, balanced stuff with a nice bitterness.

330ml bottle. Appearance: A very dark brown body, with an average to huge, thick, firm, frothy to creamy, head. Head has a good retention and leaves a decent amount of lacing. Aroma: Piney, Citrus, chocolate.
Taste: Starts with dry, dark malts, chocolate, and coffee, Increasing gradually hop bitterness, to a hopy finish. Mild sweet.
medium body, low carbonation.

A bit one dimensional in taste, allthough its a nice Black IPA, its a bit to predictable. Good but the Aroma suggest a bit more.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours black with tan head.Aroma is roasted and hoppy, slight citrus, bready. Taste is roast bitter, citrus, some smooth peaches, Full body. Roast bitter aftertaste. Good beer.

330ml bottle (Koht, Tallinn)
Almost black, large tight rocky head, corelliform lacing. Pleasant rich stout aroma, nice roast, some pleasant spicy hops too. Full palate, rich and smooth, carbonation quite low but just prevents it from being sticky. Nice malty roast taste, and very good bitter hops. Super and hoppy stout, nowhere near any kind of *PA.

330ml bottle. Darkest brown colour with average to huge, thick, firm, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, well lacing, beige head. Intense, piney, resinous, herbal and citrusy hoppy aroma, dark malty, dark chocolately background, notes of grapefruit, orange zest, a sweaty touch. Taste is initially dry, dark malty, hints of dark chocolate and coffee, continuously increasing hop bitterness, subtle sweetness. Sadly with a slightly one-dimensional kind of hoppiness in taste.

Tap. Black with nice tan head. Wonderful hop aroma of citrus, pines and hints of herbs and malts. Nice taste of chocolate, caramel,coffee and roasted malts. Aftertaste is nice malty and hoppy. Great one.

bottle at home bought at Malefitz. black color, medium big tan head. smells citric, fruity, grass, grapefruity, nutty, pines. quite nice smell. full body, bubbly carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes malty roasty, some bitterness, after a while some fruit notes come though only to be replaced by coffee and chocolate. tastes grass, pines, nuts again, citric, orange, some astringency, light roasty coffee and some chocolate, light rubbery, light soapy. dry / light herbal citric bitter finish. wow quite nice, taste is very complex, I love how one taste is replaced by another. drinks quite nice and easy.

330ml bottle. Deep black color. Spicy hops, roast, malty, fruity aroma. Nice roast, bit of chocolate, fruity, grapefruit in taste. Creamy roast in aftertaste. Medium bitterness. Alcohol is very well hidden.
Draught at Craft Bier Fest Tasting Sessions: Black color. Aroma is herbal, fruity, citric. Flavor is fruity, malty and light roasty.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Pours dark with a medium head. Some ugly stuff from the bottom of the bottle poured into the glass inadvertently spoiling the appearance a bit. Not too strong tropical fruit or resin notes in the aroma collide with dark chocolate. The taste is on the roasted side with a dominant burned coffee note, dark chocolate and a hint of tropical fruit in the aftertaste. The bitterness is low and comes from the dark malts used rather than the hops. Anyway, good and delicious - better in the taste than in the aroma.

0,33L bottle (from Drink Shop, Tallinn), BB 05.03.2016. Pours black with light brown head. The head stays. Aroma is roast, citrus, dark chocolate, sweetness. Flavor is intense roast, coffee, citrus, some sweetness in the background, feels creamy. Finish is dry and citric bitter with some alcohol burn. Overall: very nice brew.

Bottle
Aroma-resin, grapefruit
Appearance-brown, clear, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, lively, bitter finish
Overall-perfect
Bottle. Deep dark brown color. Hints of roast, licorice and citric hops in the aroma. Roasty flavor with a hint of lciorice. Dominating citric hops. Pineapple. Grassy and oily.

Kolor: Czarny, nieprzejrzysty.
Piana: Bardzo obfita. Drobnopęcherzykowa, beżowa. Trwała, pozostawia piękny lacing.
Aromat: Sosna, żywica i grapefruit. Do tego przy wąchaniu retronosowym dochodzi prażony słonecznik. Aromat jest piękny i dość intensywny.
Smak: Goryczka średnia, przyjemnie odkłada się na języku. Piwo jest żywiczno-słonecznikowe. Jest słodkawe, ale słodycz ta jest w wystarczający sposób skontrowana goryczką, żeby piwo było świetnie zbalansowane. Piwo bardzo w moim guście.
Wysycenie: Niskie do średniego. Idealne.
Opakowanie: Kolejne dzieło sztuki ze stajni Bevoga, rewelacyjna etykieta. Minus za brak podania zasypu, chmielenia i drożdży.
Uwagi: Chyba najlepsze Black IPA jakie do tej pory piłem i kolejne bardzo mocne piwo z tego browaru. Gorąco polecam. Najwyższa klasa światowa!

Aroma: citrus and pine, ashy, roasted malts, roasted sunflower seeds.
Appearance: deep brown color, really nice big beige head.
Taste: medium bitterness (pine and resin), herbs, roasted sunflower seeds, ashy, roasted dark malts, dry.
Palate: medium body and high carbonation, pine and bitter finish.
Overall: Really good Black IPA, recommended.

deep dark brown colour, huge, creamy beige-ish head; aroma of intensive citruses, resiny notes, coffee, cocoa and some cheese; taste is the mixture of a perfect citrusy-resiny IPA and a stout with roastedness - excellent Black IPA!

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2015 330 ml bottle from Grand Whisky, Vienna.
Dark brown body, with a massive, stable, frothy, rocky, dark beige head, that leaves a thick lacing.
Aroma of nuts, chocolate, slight smoke, hemp, citric hops, pine, fruits.
Tastes of dark chocolate, nuts, coffee, hemp, grass, pine, citrus, some stone fruits.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes roasty, bitter, but smooth, hoppy, piney, zesty, with dark chocolate.

Tasty. Enjoyed this even more than their previous Who Cares Black IPA. Very smooth and greatly balanced, with distinctive dark chocolate and hop notes. The best BIPA from Austria so far for me!

Easter tasting @Igors place. 0.33 bottle Igor brought from Bevog brewery, huge thanks for this. Pitch black, strong long lasting tan head, leaves a trace on the glass. A lot of exotic fruits in the aroma and taste, mango, very complex, light bitterness that lingers. A top choice!

Bottle @ Csak a Jo Sor - Only Good Beer, Budapest. Pours black with nice brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, fruity hops, citrus, light pine. Flavor is malts, cocoa, chocolate, coffee, pine, citrs, light resin. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and light bitter finish. 300315

Pours a completely black color, small particles floating around, topped with a hefty and lasting brown head. Initially very pleasant tropical fruits aroma, develops into more coffee and chocolate character. Taste starts with a slight sweetness, fruity notes, followed by very decent bitterness with coffee notes and nice herbal aftertaste. Drinkable but with lots of taste.

0,33 l bottle 
coffee, roasty, herbs, citrus, spruce, black, hazy, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear dark brown color with large creamy light brown head, tiny floating particles and excellent lacing. Aroma of passion fruit, pineapple, coffee, roasted malt with mild herbal note. Taste starts with light sweet but rich roasted malt, follows by coffee and refreshing pine with heavy bitter finish and long aftertaste. Medium to full body, oily texture and soft carbonation in palate. Rudy is my best friend :)

0,33 l bottle, Csakajosor, shared with Ogreface.
Poured deep ruby near black with a creamy light beige head. Aroma of pine and resin, juniper with some cheese, cocoa and caramel. Medium bodied ale with a bit of caramel in the middle, pine and resin of hops - moderated cocoaa and some chocolate in the base. Nice.

Shared bottle. Dark black with small tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, yeast, grassy, caramel, fruity, chocolate. Bitter, light sweet, chocolate and coffee on tongue. Bit dry, medium body, flat carbonation. Well balanced.
On tap at Edge brewing. Black colour with tan head. Fruity, peach, roasted aroma. Sweet, fruity, peach, grape, roasted taste. Medium body.
